sentences.en: But size, like sentiment, can turn a sixpence.
sentences.cn: 但就像人气一样, 规模也会有起有落.

sentences.en: He took sixpence from the palm of her hand and went to the counter to pay.
sentences.cn: 他从她手心里拿了六便士到柜台付了钱.

sentences.en: I allowed the two pennies to fall against the sixpence in my pocket.
sentences.cn: 我把口袋里的两个便士跟六便士撞在一块.

sentences.en: I gave him sixpence yesterday and advised him to save it.
sentences.cn: 我昨天给了他六便士,并建议他把这点钱积存起来.

sentences.en: In 1749 some 12, 000 people paid two shillings sixpence each to hear Handel’s 100-piece band rehearse his Royal Fireworks Music at Vauxhall Gardens(Forsyth, 1985).
sentences.cn: 大约1.2万人在1749年支付了两先令六便士，聆听了亨德尔在沃克斯霍尔园林的皇家烟火音乐的100人排练(福塞斯，1985)。

sentences.en: London taxis are easy to park because they turn on a sixpence.
sentences.cn: 伦敦的出租车很容易停车,因为它们兜的范围很小.

sentences.en: Messenger boys stealing to put on sixpence.
sentences.cn: 送信的小伙子们为了弄到六便士的赌本竟去偷窃.

sentences.en: Please give me six pennies for this sixpence.
sentences.cn: 请给我把这个六便士的硬币换成六个一便士的硬币.

sentences.en: Seven sixpence times three . Two and nine.
sentences.cn: 七先令六便士乘以三,两先令六便士.

sentences.en: Sing a song of sixpence a pocket full of rye.
sentences.cn: 唱一支六便士之歌,满口袋的黑麦.

sentences.en: Something old, something new, something borrowed, something blue and a sixpence in your shoe.
sentences.cn: 有旧, 有新, 有借, 有蓝;在一只鞋里放一枚六便士的银币.

sentences.en: the car stops on a sixpence.
sentences.cn: 这部车在很小的位置熟练地停了下来。

sentences.en: The organ - player had been ordered to go away and given sixpence.
sentences.cn: 他们给了风琴手六便士,命令他走开.

sentences.en: The sherry went to my head and I was im- poverished for days by the loss of sixpence.
sentences.cn: 六便士的酒钱落到我头上，接下来几天我几乎身无分文。 这里的女主人叫艾伦?

sentences.en: We were permitted to buy our meal tickets for seven shillings and sixpence.
sentences.cn: 允许我们买7先令6便士的进餐券.

sentences.en: Would you mind giving me the sixpence in copper?
sentences.cn: 请给我6便士铜币好 吗 ?

words.tran_cn: 六便士一本的书；电影院的六便士座位；六便士硬币

phrases.tran_cn: (英，非正式)（手法、举动或调整等可通过移动中的车辆或人）在狭小区域（或短距离）内实现的

trans.tran_en: a small silver-coloured coin worth six old  pennies  , used in Britain in the past
